com.googlecode.aluminumproject.parsers.aluscript
Class AluScriptParser

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.aluminumproject.parsers.aluscript.AluScriptParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationElement, Parser
public class AluScriptParser
extends Object
implements Parser

Parses AluScript templates.

An AluScript template consists of a number of lines. Each line is parsed by a suitable line parser. There are three kinds of lines:

  • Comments: these lines start with a # symbol and are parsed by a comment line parser;
  • Instructions: these start with an @ symbol and are parsed by the instruction line parser;
  • Text and expressions: these lines are neither comments nor instructions and are parsed by a text line parser.
Empty lines are ignored. Indentation can be used to express a parent/child relation between two lines. The only indentation that is recognised as such is the tab character.

Each template is parsed in a new context. This context contains everything that line parsers need (e.g. all available instructions). It also contains a couple of template settings. These settings have reasonable defaults, but they can be overridden:

  • The template name translator can be configured using the configuration parameter "parser.aluscript.template_name_translator.class";
  • Whether the parser inserts newlines after text lines or not can be changed by supplying the "parser.aluscript.automatic_newlines" parameter.

By default, template names should include the template extension. If this extension is the same for every template (alu is recommended), it can be configured using the "parser.aluscript.template_extension" parameter.
